result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A. Faude was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew A. Faude is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew A. Faude was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Matthew A. Faude was found guilty of Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.  
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall comply with any request of juvenile court social worker and follow any juvenile court orders.
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only with a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from only 1 pharmacy and report any medical appointments or changes to prescriptions to his Agent within 72 hours.

records.addlTxt:
DA Snider present.
Def. present.
Atty. Kate Seifert present.
State moves to amend Ct. #4 - obstructing an officer - Class A misd. 946.41(1)(2a)
NC plea
Ct. #5 - NC plea
Ct. #1, Ct. #2, and Ct. #3 dismissed outright.
Plea questionnaire filed with the Court.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of amended Ct. #4 and Ct. #5.
Statements by DA Snider - believes victim notifications have been completed.
Recommendations by counsel.
Probation - SW - 1 year concurrent
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action.
2.  pay supervision fees.
3.  def. to submit to any assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow any treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  def. to comply w/any request of juvenile court social worker and follow any juvenile court order.
5.  def. shall not possess any illegal substances.
6.  def. shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
7.  def. to possess prescription medications only w/a valid prescription and take in manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
8.  def. shall obtain prescriptions from only 1 pharmacy and report any medical appointments or changes to prescriptions to his agent w/in 72 hours.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Def. to meet w/P&P today.
